transcript: - Hey guys, it's Justine and today, we're doing a follow-up to the iPad Mini. This is the week with iPad Mini video, and honestly at this point, it's probably been a little bit over a week, but it's okay. Who's counting? I know, you are. I have been loving this so much. I've been watching movies, I've been watching shows, I've been watching Netflix. I've also just been kind of like doing email and text messages and stuff like that. I still sometimes do wish that they would have done an updated design, but the thing is this has been a consistent design for the past several years so all of those accessories, all of the cases, all of the sort of point of sale things too that businesses use, they can still use those with this. So I think that's one of the things that a lot of people have sort of been forgetting. People are using these for different things, not just content consuming devices, so being able to still use the things that they have been using for years but getting an updated device, I think, is really crucial. Also, the price point. Having something that isn't as crazy expensive as the iPad Pro, but still have the functionality and be able to use the Apple Pencil is also incredible. Of course, I'm not an illustrator. I mean I can use Photoshop and I'm still a designer, but as far as drawing and things like that, it's definitely not something that I'm good at. But I have been enjoying using Procreate and just kind of like doodling and drawing and just having fun. Like, this is beautiful. This is a work of art. Another thing that I like about the iPad Mini is just being able to take it with me, like, basically everywhere. Now I was joking about being able to put this in my yoga pants, but it actually does fit in my yoga pants pocket. Also, I was using this to fly my drone, which is kind of crazy, so being able to have a bigger screen to be able to see where I'm flying at, amazing.
